718228f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Harlem Mere.
718228f-a.text:
Central Park: Harlem Mere, in the northeastern corner of the Park; the view is north from an unidentified building on upper Fifth Avenue. The southern end of Lenox Avenue is behind the boathouse. The older part of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, on Morningside Heights, is shown in the left background.

About 1925.

Ewing Galloway.
718228f-a.folder: Central Park & Harlem Mere., Manhattan, NY

718226f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Harlem Mere.
718226f-a.text:
Central Park: A southeastern view across the Harlem Mere to show buildings on Fifth Ave. The two prominent structures at the left and center are: the Daughters of Israel Building and the Fifth Ave. Hospital.
May 18, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
718226f-a.folder: Central Park & Harlem Mere., Manhattan, NY

718230f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Harlem Mere.
718230f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, view south from the northern end, showing the midtown skyline between Fifth and Eighth Avenues, from the Hotel Plaza to the General Motors Building.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, four years later. The gigantic R. C. A. Building, at Radio City, has been added to the skyline.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
718230f-b.folder: Central Park & Harlem Mere., Manhattan, NY
